title: Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
text:
Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital NHS Foundation Trust is an <a href="NHS%20foundation%20trust">NHS foundation trust</a> located in the suburb of <a href="Broadgreen">Broadgreen</a> within the <a href="city">city</a> of <a href="Liverpool">Liverpool</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It manages the <a href="Liverpool%20Heart%20and%20Chest%20Hospital">Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital</a> which serves the population of <a href="Merseyside">Merseyside</a>, <a href="North%20West%20England">North West England</a>, <a href="North%20Wales">North Wales</a> and the <a href="Isle%20of%20Man">Isle of Man</a> but also provides some specialist services for patients from all areas of the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> performing up to 12,000 procedures a year.

Performance.
It was named by the <a href="Health%20Service%20Journal">Health Service Journal</a> as one of the top hundred NHS trusts to work for in 2015. At that time it had 1335 full-time equivalent staff and a sickness absence rate of 4.13%. 92% of staff recommend it as a place for treatment and 69% recommended it as a place to work.
The <a href="Care%20Quality%20Commission">Care Quality Commission</a> awarded LHCH an 'Outstanding' rating following their inspection in summer 2016. 2019 saw Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital become one of only five NHS service providers to receive the 'Outstanding' rating twice, resulting from a CQC inspection in February 2019.
